scenarios.title: Meeting New Friends

listening.receptive: Recognize that people are speaking in English.

reading.reading: Identify characters in a picture book.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify environmental sounds and speech sounds.

speaking.productive: Use simple words and gestures to communicate.

writing.interactive: Draw a symbol or image as a response to something.

mediation.text: Mimic simple actions shown in picture books.

assessment_ideas: Observe students’ responses to greetings and polite phrases.
Check if students can name a character who says 'please' or 'thank you'.
Assess drawings representing greetings or polite interactions.

scenarios.title: Exploring Our Classroom

listening.receptive: Follow very simple classroom instructions after observing a model.
listening.interactive: Engage in acting out and response activities.

reading.reading: Participate in choral reading of familiar short stories with support.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify environmental sounds and speech sounds.

speaking.interactive: Participate in a conversation with one or two simple interactions.

writing.interactive: Draw a symbol or image as a response to something.

mediation.communication: Express feelings and basic needs using words and body language.

grammar: Prepositions (e.g., 'The book is on the table.')
pronunciation: Environmental sounds: school bell, chairs moving

sociolinguistic: Politeness: saying 'thank you' after receiving something

assessment_ideas: Observe color naming during object identification.
Check student participation in scavenger hunts or labeling activities.
Review drawings of classroom objects with color labels.

grammar: Prepositions (e.g., 'The book is on the table.')

pragmatic: Identifying people: 'Who is this?' → 'This is my teacher.'

sociolinguistic: Classroom interactions: appropriate greetings for teacher vs. friend

assessment_ideas: Observe student introductions of people in school.
